column3:
Warm welcome as a contributor @sebastianrapp!

Interesting find! Can you describe how to reproduce the issue locally (what OS, what commands to issue, etc.)?

May I ask how you found this issue? It is always interesting to know.

Thank you very much.\nI was using macOS Big Sur (version 11.2.1) to reproduce this issue. Here I just need to run bitcoind and got the error message "Init: Not enough file descriptors available."\nSo to be honest I was wondering why this issues was not observed before as this is a pretty straightforward use case, right. So maybe I have any special setting in my system of which I am currently not
I don't have any Mac around to test on unfortunately: anyone running macOS who is able to reproduce this?

It is kind of strange, as functions such as `open` `read` `write` return or take an `int` >= 0 there would be no possible reason for there ever to be more than 2**31 file descriptors, so I cannot see the rationale of using a larger type for the limit. That said if this is necessary on some platforms it's necessary.\n\nEdit: well strictly if you want to use file descriptor 0x7fff_ffff you do need
